unnormalised: **CBSE Announces Class 10 Results; Overall Pass Percentage at 93.12%**
normalised: C-B-S-E Announces Class Ten Results; Overall Pass Percentage at ninety three point one two percent

unnormalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) declared the results for the Class 10 examinations today, May 13, 2024. The overall pass percentage stood at 93.12%, marking a slight increase of 0.5% compared to the previous year's 92.62%. The results were made available on the CBSE's official website, cbseresults.nic.in, and students can access their scores using their roll number, date of birth, and school code.
normalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (C-B-S-E) declared the results for the Class Ten examinations today, May thirteenth, two thousand and twenty four. The overall pass percentage stood at ninety three point one two percent, marking a slight increase of zero point five percent compared to the previous year's ninety two point six two percent. The results were made available on the C-B-S-E's official website, c-b-s-e-results dot n-i-c dot in, and students can access their scores using their roll number, date of birth, and school code.

unnormalised: Girls once again outperformed boys, with a pass percentage of 94.25% as against 92.01% for boys. This continues the trend of girls consistently achieving higher academic results in the CBSE examinations. A total of 21,84,127 students registered for the Class 10 exams this year, out of which 20,34,339 successfully cleared the examination.
normalised: Girls once again outperformed boys, with a pass percentage of ninety four point two five percent as against ninety two point zero one percent for boys. This continues the trend of girls consistently achieving higher academic results in the C-B-S-E examinations. A total of two million, one hundred and eighty four thousand, one hundred and twenty seven students registered for the Class Ten exams this year, out of which two million, thirty four thousand, three hundred and thirty nine successfully cleared the examination.

unnormalised: The board did not release a merit list this year, as it had discontinued the practice of announcing toppers to reduce undue stress and competition among students. However, the board did issue certificates of merit to the top 0.1% of students in each subject.
normalised: The board did not release a merit list this year, as it had discontinued the practice of announcing toppers to reduce undue stress and competition among students. However, the board did issue certificates of merit to the top zero point one percent of students in each subject.

unnormalised: Region-wise, Trivandrum recorded the highest pass percentage at 99.91%, followed by Bengaluru at 99.22% and Chennai at 98.75%. Delhi East and Delhi West recorded pass percentages of 96.85% and 95.64% respectively. Schools have been directed to provide marksheets and certificates to students at the earliest convenience.
normalised: Region-wise, Trivandrum recorded the highest pass percentage at ninety nine point nine one percent, followed by Bengaluru at ninety nine point two two percent and Chennai at ninety eight point seven five percent. Delhi East and Delhi West recorded pass percentages of ninety six point eight five percent and ninety five point six four percent respectively. Schools have been directed to provide marksheets and certificates to students at the earliest convenience.

unnormalised: The CBSE has also announced the schedule for compartment exams, which will be held in July 2024. Students who did not pass in one or two subjects will be eligible to appear for the compartment exams to improve their scores and clear the Class 10 examination. The application process for the compartment exams will commence in the first week of June.
normalised: The C-B-S-E has also announced the schedule for compartment exams, which will be held in July two thousand and twenty four. Students who did not pass in one or two subjects will be eligible to appear for the compartment exams to improve their scores and clear the Class Ten examination. The application process for the compartment exams will commence in the first week of June.

unnormalised: In a statement, CBSE Chairman Ms. Nidhi Chibber congratulated the students, teachers, and parents for their collective effort in achieving these results. She emphasized the importance of holistic education and encouraged students to pursue their passions and interests. The board has also set up a helpline number, 1800-11-8004, to provide counselling and support to students and parents.
normalised: In a statement, C-B-S-E Chairman M-s. Nidhi Chibber congratulated the students, teachers, and parents for their collective effort in achieving these results. She emphasized the importance of holistic education and encouraged students to pursue their passions and interests. The board has also set up a helpline number, one eight hundred hyphen eleven hyphen eight thousand and four, to provide counselling and support to students and parents.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the board clarified that re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from May 16 to May 20, 2024. The fee for re-evaluation is Rs. 500 per subject. Students are advised to carefully review their marks before applying for re-evaluation. The CBSE also cautioned students against falling prey to fraudulent websites promising to increase marks in exchange for money.
normalised: Furthermore, the board clarified that re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from May sixteenth to May twentieth, two thousand and twenty four. The fee for re-evaluation is rupees five hundred per subject. Students are advised to carefully review their marks before applying for re-evaluation. The C-B-S-E also cautioned students against falling prey to fraudulent websites promising to increase marks in exchange for money.
